ð¨ Mexico City isnât just a destinationâitâs a canvas come to life.

Welcome to CDMX, where ancient temples meet colonial grandeur, and street art meets skyscrapers. A sprawling, buzzing mega-city of 21 million, pulsing with color, culture, and creativity at every turn ð²ð½â¨

Start in the historic heart: ZÃ³calo, once the sacred center of the Aztec world. Today, itâs crowned by the Metropolitan Cathedral, surrounded by over 1500 heritage buildings in Centro HistÃ³rico ðï¸
Step into the House of Tiles (Casa de Azulejos), the ornate Palacio de Bellas Artes, and the mural-covered walls of San Ildefonso College.
Lose yourself in color at La Ciudadela Market, home to over 300 stalls of artisan brilliance ð¨ðª¡

Green is the new gold at Chapultepec Park, one of the worldâs largest city parks ð³. Visit the Museum of Anthropology, Chapultepec Zoo, or climb to the Castillo to explore the highs and lows of Mexicoâs history ð²ð½

Head north to Nuevo Polanco, where futuristic landmarks like the Museo Soumaya and Museo Jumex showcase everything from Rodin to Warhol.

To the south lies the soul of Mexico CityâCoyoacÃ¡n, Frida Kahloâs beloved bohemian home ðº. Visit her Blue House, then trace her creative love story with Diego Rivera in San Angel.

At Ciudad Universitaria, Riveraâs final mural graces the Olympic stadiumâhis last masterpiece in a city he helped paint with vision and power ðð­

Explore the leafy charm of Roma and Condesa, where bougainvillea spills over Art Deco balconies ð¸ And donât miss Xochimilco, where you can float through Mexicoâs last Aztec canals on colorful trajineras, dancing to mariachi and sipping micheladas ð¶ð

Mexico City doesnât whisper. It sings. In colors, in murals, in markets, and in memory. All you have to do is close your eyes and youâll see them againâtoday, tomorrow, always.

The Amalfi Coastâa place so legendary, it feels like a dream before you even arriveâ¦ and a memory that haunts you long after you leave ð­â¨

Stretching along 30 miles of Southern Italyâs Sorrentine Peninsula, this stunning coastline is a string of seaside gems, hillside vineyards, fragrant lemon groves, and ancient history ðð

Begin in Amalfi, once a mighty maritime republic, where gold once replaced bartering and grand cathedrals like SantâAndrea still whisper tales of past glory âªï¸
Stroll up to Pontone, the old escape of Amalfiâs elite, or wander through Atrani, Italyâs smallest municipality, untouched by time and tradition ðï¸

Explore the hidden gorge at Fiordo di Furore, once a hideout for bandits, then bask in the coastal magic of Positano, where ancient myths tell of Ulysses resisting the Sirensâ call ð«
From its pebbled beaches to the pastel-hued cliffside homes, Positano has been glittering with celebrity allure since the '50s ðº

Climb into the hills to reach Ravello, where the views from Villa Cimbroneâs Terrace of Infinity earned Gore Vidalâs praise as âthe most beautiful view in the worldâ ðð¿
Explore Villa Rufolo, once home to aristocrats, now an inspiration to artists and musicians.

Follow winding coastal roads to the peaceful fishing villages of Minori and Maiori, summer retreats for Roman nobility. Relax on the regionâs widest beaches or wander up to the fortress-like Castle of San Nicola de Thoro-Plano, guarding tales from centuries past ð°

Whether you're hiking the Path of the Gods, sipping limoncello, or soaking in the Mediterranean sun, the Amalfi Coast is pure enchantment.
As John Steinbeck wrote: âA dream placeâ¦ that isnât quite real when you are there and becomes beckoningly real after you have gone.â

ðCome chase that dream.

ð Houstonâwe have everything! ð«
From moon landings to bayou boardwalks, this Gulf Coast giant blends southern charm, cosmic ambition, and down-to-earth culture like no other.

Start your journey at Discovery Green, where art and skyline meet, then dive into Houstonâs Museum Districtâhome to 18 world-class museums within walking distance. ð¨
Stroll through The Menil Collection, admire masterpieces at the Museum of Fine Arts, or come face to face with wildlife at Houston Zoo ð

Find peace in the Japanese gardens at Hermann Park, or run wild through the trails of Memorial Park and the serene Arboretum ð³
Float along Buffalo Bayou, then stand where Texas claimed its independence at the San Jacinto Monument. Step aboard the legendary Battleship Texas, a relic of two world wars. âï¸

But Houston doesnât just remember historyâit makes it.
At Space Center Houston, walk in the footsteps of astronauts and relive mankindâs giant leap ð
This city was the first to hear: âHouston, Tranquility Base here. The Eagle has landed.â

When the Gulf Coast heat turns up, head to Kemah Boardwalk for ocean breezes and classic fun ð¡ Or feel the thrill at Galvestonâs Historic Pleasure Pier ð¢
Need to cool off? Escape into the futuristic pyramids of Moody Gardensâhome to aquariums, rainforests, and discovery centers ðð¦

As the sun sets, let the salty breeze guide you to a sizzling Tex-Mex feast, and toast to a city thatâs always looking skyward. ð®ð

ð Big, bold, and bursting with lifeâHouston truly is the brightest star in Texas.
